discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D
['ietf-interfaces:interfaces']['interface'] - will return a list of individual interfaces

The question indicated confusion on “interfaces” vs “interface” in the URL. The fact that “interface” appears 3 times in the path can make it confusing. But there is a reason for each of them: 

 ietf-interfaces – the module name
 :interfaces – a container called “interfaces” (Note: containers in YANG are used to group and organize other attributes)
 interface – a list of individual network interfaces. Each interface in the list is uniquely identified by its name.


module: ietf-interfaces 
 +--rw interfaces 
 | +--rw interface* [name] 
 | +--rw name string 
 | +--rw description? string 
 | +--rw type identityref 
 | +--rw enabled? boolean 
 | +--rw link-up-down-trap-enable? enumeration {if-mib}?

Selected Answer: D
D was the best answer.

Refer: https://developer.cisco.com/docs/ios-xe/#!zero-touch-provisioning/ztp-with-http-server-running-on-ubuntu-vm

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A Python script is used to configure a Cisco IOS XE device. The script must be updated to print the IP addresses of all the loopback interfaces. Which statement should be added before the loop?
Which environment must be enabled to complete the Zero-Touch Provisioning process on a Cisco IOS XE device?

FILL BLANK -
Fill in the blank to complete the statement.
___________________ is a solution for automating the configuration of a device when it is first powered on, using DHCP and TFTP.

DRAG DROP -
Drag and drop the characteristic from the left onto the monitoring type described on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
The only characteristic of traditional network monitoring is "ask network devices for any metric at any time" when this is polled by SNMP.
In streaming telemetry this is pushed periodically or when it is generated which prevents that networks device listen to SNMP poll requests.
I believe the expected answer is incorrect. The item that corresponds to traditional network monitoring is "Requesting specific metrics from network devices at any time."

ST : Minimize
ST : prevent 
ST Troubleshoot
TNM : ask network devices for any metric anytime
"ask network devices for any metric at any time"

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A RESTCONF GET request is sent to a Cisco IOS XE device. A portion of the response is shown in the exhibit. Which module name corresponds to the YANG model referenced in the request?

discussion.content:
D. is correct answer 
Module ietf-interfaces everything after the column is a container.
Source:https://yangcatalog.org/yang-search/yang_tree/ietf-interfaces@2018-02-20

Selected Answer: D
D

ietf-interfaces > MODULE
:interfaces > CONTAINER
ietf-ipv > MODULE 

Through augmentation, the ietf-interfaces model is “augmented” by the ietf-ip model to add IPv4.

Selected Answer: D
ietf-interfaces > MODULE
ietf-ipv4 > CONTAINER 

D is the correct
